attributes.action: Hold a new EU referendum if there is a major shift in public opinion.
attributes.background: The consequences of leave have, until now, been pure speculation.  They are now facts and becoming clear: a fall in the pound, threatened major job losses, the break up of the UK.  Had these consequences been clear before the vote, the public may have voted differently and should confirm the vote.

attributes.action: Set up an inquiry into the impact of press reporting on the Brexit vote
attributes.background: A referendum such as on Brexit relies on informed decision making by the public. It is understandable that each side will represent their position in the best light possible. But we need to understand if any persons manipulated public opinion through press reporting beyond the legally acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: Just like the Chilcot inquiry into the Iraq war and the potential manipulation of public opinion through the media, we need a similar inquiry about whether any actors had vested interest in a Brexit and if so, whether they did take any steps to manipulate public opinion in an unacceptable, illegal manner by impacting press reporting on Brexit.

attributes.action: Implement a 2nd EU Referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the HM Government to debate and implement a second referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote as the results effect everyone not only voters aged 18 and over.

attributes.action: Demand a re-evaluation of the Barnett Formula in the wake of leaving the EU
attributes.background: Due to gross inequality in the funding of the home nations by Westminister thus far, extra help from the EU pot has been essential in order to help some regions of the UK to thrive. Now that we've voted to leave, the Barnett Formula must be re-evaluated and modified to meet the needs of the people.
attributes.additional_details: Devolution: What's the Barnett formula? - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-29477233

attributes.action: Improve refugee policies! Create Syrian refugee policies similar to Germany's!
attributes.background: Five years a war has been raging in Syria! Thousands of innocents are being killed! Millions more are pouring out of Syria, desperate to get to Europe. Instead of doing our utmost to help them we have barred them from our doors! The amount of refugees we've admitted would fit on a train!
attributes.additional_details: Under great pressure the government decided to allow UNNACOMPANIED CHILDREN to enter the country. Apparently nobody likes looking at pictures of 2yr olds and knowing we've sentenced them to death! But it's not just toddlers who can die crossing the Channel. The sight of emaciated 30yr olds huddling on the ground, trying to keep warm should hurt too! Where is your compassion Brits? Where is your pity?

attributes.action: Adjust the status of UK residents on Tier2 ICT visa or cancel it from visa types
attributes.background: The Tier2 ICT visa is a new modern slavery, this visa status takes away all your privileges as a human. You pay equal tax as a UK resident yet because people knows that you can't stay for longer than 5 years there are many things you cant do, in my case: adopt, get a mortgage, change jobs and more
attributes.additional_details: UK government have changed the laws so that everyone who's living in UK for more than 183 days becomes a resident and pay tax, however, people in Tier2 ICT visa status do not get any benefits to the contrary, if they can't find a job outside UK within 5 years they end up paying an equal tax to a resident, stuck in a job they don't want to do (many employers abuse there ICT people because they know they own them), no bank will give you a mortgage because they can't trust what will happen to you in 5 years.

attributes.action: Government fund Boot Camps for teenagers instead of children's homes and units
attributes.background: More and more children and teenagers become worse off after being referred to care homes and units. The reason being is that they end up establishing new relationships with others who have considerably worse issues. The result of this can have a severe negative impact rather than help the situation.
attributes.additional_details: We want to prevent children and teenagers from enduring this type of situation. They also regularly go missing from homes resulting in more police resources. Police have confirmed that missing children is a regularity which is often a waste of police time. If we were to introduce teenage bootcamps it would prevent a lot of future crime and saving expenses on services such as police, social work, alcohol addiction, drug rehabilitation, psychologists, prison sentences, teenage pregnancies and more

attributes.action: Call for a vote of no confidence in PM Cameron post EU referendum.
attributes.background: In the event of a leave majority in the forth coming EU referendum we the people request that all Members of Parliament be made directly aware by the House of Commons Speaker to the announcement of our desire for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister David Cameron.

attributes.action: Boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background:
After the violence and racism by Russian supporters in the Euro 2016 football tournament in France. 
I would like the Government Ministers to boycott anything to do with the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
attributes.additional_details: If our government can do this. It will show they are looking out for the safety of the British Citizens which would be at risk if they were to fly out there. And with Government support, the British people, FA, World Cup sponsors and other qualifying countries may consider boycotting the tournament as well. Our Gouvernment needs to show it will not support at tournament that was won on bribes and cannot promise the safety of the British public.

attributes.action: Make vaccine inserts mandatory to receive before being given any vaccination.
attributes.background: This isn't about being pro or anti vaccinations. This is about knowledge and being able to make an informed choice in whichever choice you choose.
attributes.additional_details: By reading the vaccine insert it will help educate the person on the possible adverse reactions, it will help parents notice vaccine damage a lot earlier if it arises, you will be able to read the study details and see all ingredients in the vaccination before deciding to go ahead with them.

attributes.action: The government to put political pressure on the US to impose gun restrictions.
attributes.background: It is embarrassing for our nation to be in a close relationship with a country that refuses to put the safety of its citizens first. Today yet another mass shooting has taken place and over 50 members of the LGBT community have died. We can not support any government that allows this to happen.

attributes.action: Stop testing children in Year 1 on 'alien' words (words that have been made up)!
attributes.background: In Year 1 children take a phonics check.  It is a test made up of real and 'made up' words.  The child is tested to make sure their phonics knowledge is at the expected level.  They should only be tested on real words that are in the dictionary.
attributes.additional_details: It seems so silly to test children who can read fluently on words they will never come across again as they are no where to be found within the English dictionary.  Words such as 'quather' or 'jove'.  The English language is not a phonetically correct language.  We have 26 letters and 44 sounds (43 in some areas because of dialect differences).  Rules for some words are not the same for other words for example, come and home.  The 'o' sound in both words are very different.

attributes.action: Close all remaining 'City' zoo's.
attributes.background: After the events this bank holiday weekend, we feel enough is enough. No longer shall we pay to see animals held in closed captivity. City zoo's across the country should be closed. With such great places as West Midlands safari etc there is no need for city zoo's, anymore.

attributes.action: Provide access to NHS prescriptions for adults diagnosed privately with  ADHD
attributes.background: Adult  ADHD  treatments and knowledge in the NHS is poor. Adults are  descriminated against, even though they make it cheaper for the NHS. The NHS will not prescribed ADHD medication via a shared care agreement between an NHS GP and a private psychiatrist.
attributes.additional_details: Diagnosis and treatment of adult ADHD is not as effective. The NHS is unable to provide adequate resources to manage ADHD.If the NHS had effective methods of diagnosing adult ADHD, and the specialists required then many would have their medications prescribed by the NHS, however this is not he case. Many are forced to go private and when a shared care agreement is requested they decline it. The guidance (GMC, NICE and BMA) does not state that the private consultant had to be NHS, just qualified.

attributes.action: Make London the test city for medical/recreational marijuana
attributes.background:
Create a legal market for marijuana in the UK. With the goal of taking money out of crinmals hands, collecting tax to be used in the health and education sector and to get access to an organic substance that is safer than alcohol.
Age Limit - 20+
Possession for personal consumption - 2 Ounces

attributes.action: Teach about the full LGBTQ* spectrum as part of the PSHE curriculum.
attributes.background: If the government made it mandatory for students to be taught about the LGBTQ* spectrum I feel it would drastically decrease bullying and ignorance, as well as making students possibly feel better about themselves if they understand that their feelings are normal.
attributes.additional_details: As a high school student myself I have noticed a distinct lack of education regarding LGBTQ* people, despite the fact that 1 in every 10 people is either lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgender.

attributes.action: Change the railway lines for a faster train from Weymouth to London
attributes.background: The train takes 3 hours From Weymouth to London (138 miles) and it takes 2 hours 44 minutes from Liverpool to London (222miles).The old Victorian lines are not good enough for a faster train.

attributes.action: Mandatory air rifle registration with a 2 year period to register.
attributes.background:
Make mandatory registration of air rifles.
Currently in the UK anyone can own an air rifle & use these to illegally shoot on lands without permission committing the acts of armed trespass and poaching.
Some shoot pets escape prosecution and costs owners thousands of pounds!
www.ukgunbook.com
attributes.additional_details:
By making registration mandatory ( 2 year period to register ) it will help solve crimes of pets that have been shot and / or killed.
It will also make sure that owners are punished for offences committed with their weapons.
We dont want to stop people shooting, we just want to ensure those that own weapons are using them sensibly, on lands with permission.
Similar to the UK Gunlaws on ShotGun ownership.
£15 per weapon registration and £10 per year renewal fees for up to 10 serialised weapons.

attributes.action: Introduce a rule to prevent the trading of insults and irrelevant remarks at PMQ
attributes.background: The Prime Minister as an elected public official and head of the UK government, responsible for the policy and decisions of the government should not be using PMQ as an opportunity to trade insults and to make irrelevant remarks that do not relate to questions posed.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months responses, quality of debate and the PM's behaviour at PMQ has reached a level that is now unacceptable, as it condones behaviour that would not be accepted in other spheres of society or workplace. The House of Parliament is a working environment, in which MPs of all parties are paid by UK tax payers to govern and formulate policies to benefit society, therefore it is right and proper that questions asked at PMQ are answered in a respectful manner.

attributes.action: Change the law to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition is change the law, to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence, with specific minimum punishments for those convicted.
With social media becoming the main portal for people to share their lives with others, cyber bullying is on the increase.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullies must face harsher punishments. With self harming and suicide on the rise, social media truly does play a part with it being noted that all teenagers who socialise online will come across cyber bullying at least once. However, it is not just teenagers who are subjected to this online torture, with the internet becoming the new venue to host the modern day witch hunt. It is time that cyber bullies were held accountable and suitably sentenced for their actions.

attributes.action: Debate the EU's Five Presidents’ Report & its likely impact on the UK.
attributes.background:
The report proposes the completion of Europe’s Economic, Monetary & Political Union.  It uses the terms 'euro area' and 'EU' in relation to its propositions; thus a likely impact on non-euro sovereign states such as the UK.
My concern is that our MPs are not fully aware of its content or impact.
attributes.additional_details:
The report can be accessed at: https://ec.europa.eu/priorities/publications/five-presidents-report-completing-europes-economic-and-monetary-union_en.
It states, 'And finally, towards a Political Union that provides the foundation - - - '. 
It uses doublespeak such as, 'The euro is a successful and stable currency', not withstanding the intractable problems a common currency has given countries such as Greece.

attributes.action: lower the minimum working age to 12 years old
attributes.background: at the moment the minimum working age is 14 and we think that it should be lower as it gives younger children real life experience and it gives the children a chance to earn money.

attributes.action: Increase fines and add 3 penalty points for illegally parking in disabled spaces
attributes.background: Abuse of Disabled parking keeps increasing. The disruption and physical pain of having to walk further because a non Blue Badge holder has taken a space, and those who use others badges because they want to get closer and not park further, now has to stop.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers only see the outside of a person, they dont feel the pain, or other effects that the so called invisible illness causes, which is why they were issued with the badge.  Drivers have not learnt the lesson and wont unless radical action is taken.  It it therefore proposed that any car owner without a badge or those who abuse a badge are fined not £60 but £300 and 3 points on the licence. The law is too leanient and has no effect. I ask everyone to support this MP's as well

attributes.action: Independent, more stringent scrutiny of MPs' interests, influences & conflicts
attributes.background: Need independent body with more stringent rules/codes on all historical, current & planned outside interests, potential influences & conflicts of interests, & their full declaration, so our elected/non-elected representatives work to the highest ethical & moral standards that engender public trust.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM & all MPs/candidates should be scrutinised by an independent body using more stringent, clear rules & do the honourable thing accordingly.

1.	Aim is to increase public trust in our democratic process & our politicians.
2.	Need to minimise conflicts of interest/influence that might bias MPs’ opinions, decisions, actions etc. (including investments, corporate/foreign deals, donations, second jobs, consultancies etc.); need full declarations at point of potential impact.
3.	Need transparency based on plain-English declarations of conflicts (not just posting tax returns that can hide all kinds of other investments/financial interests).

attributes.action: Government must provide Framework Documents on governance after EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Government provided the People of the UK with a referendum on whether they wish to stay in or leave the EU. The Government must therefore provide two framework documents that give clear guidance on how the UK would be governed under each option so that the People can reach a considered decision
attributes.additional_details:
Background information on why the Government should provide these two framework documents and the consequences if they do not, can be reviewed by the following link

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6nprf1f6wrth3bx/The%20forthcoming%20EU%20Referendum_Revision%201_Final%20Draft.pdf?dl=0

attributes.action: The UK to join the Eurozone
attributes.background: Without integration into the Eurozone the UK will always remain a fringe state of the European union, both economically and politically, with this integration tourism and trade between the other Eurozone countries will become more efficient and build stronger political ties with other major nations.

attributes.action: It's time to make the UK Lottery have minimum pay-outs
attributes.background: There should be minimum pay-outs for 4, 5, and 5 plus the bonus ball. It should come out of their exorbitant profits, they have already moved the goalposts by increasing the price and numbers on the draw , time to be fairer, or time for a total boycott

attributes.action: Make domestic violence a crime in its own right with clear sentencing guidelines
attributes.background: The impact of domestic violence on victims and children and the financial and emotional cost to society is huge. Violence is rarely an isolated event but part of a campaign. Again and again, perpetrators walk free from court  or receive nominal sentences: proportionate justice for victims is rare.
attributes.additional_details: Watch BBC's Behind Closed Doors and consider how often the sentence actually fits the crime and achieves justice for victims of DV. See www.cps.gov.uk/legal/s_to_u/sentencing_manual for common assault, actual bodily harm and grievous bodily harm. Unless the assault breaks the skin or bones, highest charge is ABH, max sentence is 5 years, likely 3 or less, out in half the time, minus remand time: likely released from court or very shortly after. Impact on victims and children is lifelong.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of malling health at telford town centre
attributes.background: It was announced today that the walk in centre and gp practise is being closed down leaving over 3000 patients without a gp please help stop this up coming closure it took me a long time to find a decent gp and have been at this gp practise myself for 6 years

attributes.action: Make anyone who claims benefits do a few hours of community service a day
attributes.background: Anyone who claims benefits because they don't work, should be made to do a few hours of community service each day. I feel this would help as they are earning the money and giving back to the community, there is no reason for people to be getting money without working for it.
attributes.additional_details: This can also give people who are unable to find work added experience towards their CV, possibly making it easier for them to find a job in the future.

attributes.action: Make childcare costs exempt from Income tax
attributes.background:
We request the Government to make the child care costs exempt from income tax. This will help in two ways
1. Help provide relief to families 
2. Help bring more people especially women into the workforce.
attributes.additional_details:
1. According to an OECD report - The UK has the highest costs of childcare for any country apart from Switzerland - 26.6% of average family incomes, compared to an OECD average of 11.8%.  
2.  While the long term solution would be to bring the childcare costs down, making them tax exempt would atleast provide some relief in the interim.
3. Families are bringing up the future generation, who will work, contribute to pensions, support the elderly and society.

attributes.action: Treat war pensions the same as the state pension, apply a triple lock increase.
attributes.background: The war pension scheme currently rises in line with the consumer price index measure of inflation.  The state old age pension rises by 2.5% or in line with average pay increases.

attributes.action: Training on Mental Health for Ambulance service
attributes.background: It appears the Ambulance staff do not get the relevant training in Mental Health and they are faced with Mental Health patients on a daily basis. This is becoming more common but frontline staff do not have the skills to deal with risky, suicidal patients, why are they not having the training?
attributes.additional_details: As Mental Health is becoming more common as physical health it is agreed by frontline staff and Mental Health staff that they should have adequate training in Mental Health.

attributes.action: Free fruit should be given to children in schools! To promote healthilyLifestyle
attributes.background: Free fruit should be given out to children in schools to help promote healthier lifestyle to combate vast illness.Like obesity,dieabetes and other chronic illness.This would help take some pressure off the NHS ,improve people general health and well-being and mental health!
attributes.additional_details:
(NCMP) 2014/15, show that 19.1% of children in Year 6 (aged 10-11) were obese and a further 14.2% were overweight. Of children in Reception (aged 4-5), 9.1% were obese and another 12.8% were overweight. This means a third of 10-11 year olds and over a fifth of 4-5 year olds were overweight or obese. 

Estimated of (those costs arising from the impact of obesity on the wider economy such as loss of productivity) over the same time period ranged between £2.6 billion [1] and £15.8 billion.[2]

attributes.action: Demand a public inquiry into how EU medical expenses have been going unclaimed.
attributes.background: New figures show the NHS is paying out millions more for EU healthcare than it is claiming back from EU countries.Described as a "scandalous failure",it has emerged that the UK pays more than £670m to EU countries for Brits' healthcare abroad, while claiming back less than £50m from the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
MP John Mann, who obtained the figures in a parliamentary question, told Sky News that "logically the UK should be receiving more than it pays out".

He estimates "the real cost is a billion pounds a year". 

Mr Mann told Sky News: "Other countries are recharging and we are not.

"The figures are astonishing - we are paying them 70 times more than they are paying us.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for medicinal cures that work to be kept from being used
attributes.background: There are cures for several types of cancers and various other diseases, but because the medicine companies gain more money from treatment they are a happy to let people die.
attributes.additional_details: There have been trials for cures of leukemia 99 out of 100 people were cured but because pharmaceutical companies would lose money by giving out cures rather than traditional treatment they haven't released the cure and they won't!!

attributes.action: Ban and shoot down drones flying near airports before the inevitable happens.
attributes.background:
Did we get enough near misses to realise that we have a problem?
Drones can now carry a 10 lbs charge, which could destroy an airplane in midair.

Each airport needs military equipment to track down and neutralise drones that violate the restricted airspace.

attributes.action: Make life sentences in prison proper life sentences.
attributes.background: I propose for life sentences in prison to mean proper life sentences in prison!! Not just life sentences but in fact all prison sentences. If you break the law you should do the punishment!!  Life should mean life, 20 years should mean 20 years etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm fed up hearing people getting slaps on the wrist or people being allowed out on day release and absconding. 

Time to put things right and make prisoners pay the price.

attributes.action: Allow 15-17 year olds who take an interest in the EU Referendum to vote.
attributes.background: 15-17 year olds are a group that are not listened to enough. This needs to change, as the outcome of the referendum is something that will affect the future generation. If a 15-17 year old can prove that they take a genuine interest in the referendum, then they should be allowed to have their say.

attributes.action: The local education authority should be put back in charge of schools.
attributes.background: I have had an issue with my daughters primary school head and where ever I go to complain I'm told I must go through the Govenors which is pointless as they are all directed by the headteacher, who is not answerable to anyone

attributes.action: Call for an independent review of the recent local government finance settlement
attributes.background: “The Government announced a £300m fund to help ease the pain of the cuts, but instead of giving it to areas that have had the biggest cuts, they gave it to wealthier areas run by Conservative councils that have had the least cuts since 2010.
attributes.additional_details: After complaints that Government funding cuts were too severe, the Government announced a £300m ‘relief fund’ to help affected areas.  But instead of targeting the money on areas with the biggest cuts, 85% of it has been sent to areas with the lowest levels of deprivation that have experienced the least cuts. Most of these areas are run by Conservative councils. There are concerns public money was used as a political fix to buy votes for the Tories in the run-up to elections in May.

attributes.action: Make all public houses in Nottinghamshire wheelchair accessible.
attributes.background:
I believe all public places should be accessible for all of our people. Places such as shopping centers, pubs, clubs, etc. 
All residents should feel invited and not excluded.

attributes.action: abolish hate crime laws in the UK
attributes.background: A crime is a crime. the motivation for committing the offence should be inconsequential to the sentencing. Labelling an offence as racially, religiously or gender motivated only serves to create an 'us and them' mentality.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months police have been silencing anti  Islam and anti  refugee opinions by labelling them as hate crimes. recently Nottinghamshire police have taken the law into their own hands and have made misogyny a hate crime (but not misandry). This has turned certain groups into protected classes in society.

attributes.action: Parliament must approve the PM's plan for Brexit before Article 50 is invoked.
attributes.background: The Government’s plan for Brexit must be rigorously scrutinised by Parliament, before Article 50 is invoked. MPs should consider whether the Government’s plan is realistic, achievable, adequately manages risk and benefits all the people of Britain. MPs have a duty to ensure high quality planning.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot report describes the failures of government planning and inadequate Parliamentary scrutiny that led to the disastrous intervention in Iraq. Should Article 50 be invoked, without a plan scrutinised by parliament, as some propose, we could see a future enquiry coming to similar conclusions about Brexit.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of cruel halal meat in the UK
attributes.background: Stop the cruel slaughter of innocent animals for halal meat. Stop the sale of halal meat in UK.

attributes.action: Government inquiry in to the award of the 2016 East Anglian Rail Franchise.
attributes.background:
Despite abysmal performance and failing the customer for many years, Abellio have been rewarded the East Anglian franchise.

We call for a full pubic review into this decision and a reassessment of the competitive bids.

attributes.action: Remove roadside signs supported on steel girders
attributes.background: As a retained firefighter for Hampshire Fire and Rescue Service I have recently attended  an rtc where a van came into contact with a roadside motorway sign which was mounted on steel girders. This collision left the driver with life changing injuries. There are a number of these signs on the m3.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the construction of these signs is a danger to life and there appears to be more lightweight options available that are in use in other areas of the motorway system. A vehicle coming into contact with these signs supported on steel girders will quiet simply be cut in half by the force of the collision. I recently attended an incident on the m3 near Basingstoke where a driver lost a leg.

attributes.action: Increase the Carer's Allowance to £80 per week, from £62.10 per week
attributes.background: There are an estimated 6.5 million carers in the UK, meaning that 1 in 10 people have caring duties. Unpaid carers save the UK government £119 billion per year, more than is spent on the NHS. To receive the carers allowance, you must care for 35 hours a week, when many care for 100 hours or more.
attributes.additional_details: Working up to 100 hours, the Carer's Allowance equates to 62p per hour, in contrast to the minimum wage of £7.20 per hour. The burden of caring is great, with 625,000 carers suffering from mental or physical illnesses - around the population of Glasgow. The problem will only get worse with 6,000 people becoming carers every day - these people need help now.

attributes.action: To enforce that the CMS deal with both maintenance & contact thorough mediation
attributes.background: For the CMS to enforce that mediation must be attended by both parents in exchange for their  services. Both contact and maintenance are discussed and put to the courts. Solicitors and mediatiors can attend. Saving so much trouble and heart ache.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last two years I have gone through great troubles to arrange contact with my son Lucas. Since going through this I have noticed that there are several people going through the same... Alienation, unfair judgement in court, expensive solicitors. The CMS has sonics  legal power to peruse the money but don't do the same for contact. Making it easier to seperate a non living parent from their child with no obligation to maintain a healthy relationship between them. This must be stopped .

attributes.action: Make the government take a more active role in providing food for those in need.
attributes.background: We are campaigning on behalf of over 1.1 million people in the UK who have needed emergency food supplies from The Trussell Trust in the last year (1). Food bank usage is on the rise, but we believe it is the government's responsibility to provide food for their people, not that of the food banks.
attributes.additional_details:
The emergency food supplied by The Trussell Trust is estimated as less than half the number of the total amount of emergency food supplies distributed in the UK (2). However the government plan to cut welfare by £3bn by 2020 (2).

References:
1. https://www.trusselltrust.org/news-and-blog/latest-stats/#fy-2015-2016
2. http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/food-bank-usage-at-record-high-reveals-trussell-trust-a6984921.html
